description: Borrowed from Middle French salutaire and its source, Latin salutaris (“healthful”), from salus (“health”).

adjectives.description: salutary (comparative more salutary, superlative most salutary)

entries.meaning: Effecting or designed to effect an improvement; remedial: salutary advice.
examples: We do it here historically, and I think it's, um, very salutary to know quite a bit about the history of ideas, particularly in philosophy which always suffers from a tendency to follow the latest fashion.

entries.meaning: Promoting good health and physical well-being; wholesome; curative.
